form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Curtis (for himself and Mr. Kelly) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Budget

form.official-title: To amend the Water Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act of 2014 with respect to budgetary treatment of certain amounts of financial assistance, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Restoring WIFIA Eligibility Act of 2025.

section.header: Budgetary treatment of certain amounts of financial assistance
section.text: The Water Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act of 2014 (33 U.S.C. 3901 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Budgetary treatment of certain amounts of financial assistance
section.text: If the recipient of financial assistance for a project under this subtitle is an eligible entity other than a Federal entity, agency, or instrumentality, and the dedicated sources of repayment of that financial assistance are non-Federal revenue sources, the financial assistance shall, for purposes of budgetary treatment under the Federal Credit Reform Act of 1990 (2 U.S.C. 661 et seq.)â€”

paragraph.text: be deemed to be non-Federal; and
be treated as a direct loan or loan guarantee (as those terms are defined in section 502 of that Act (2 U.S.C. 661a)).
